name: Convergence
tagline: Become what you were meant to be.
ideology: Humanity's limitations caused the collapse. Enhancement is not betrayal of humanity—it's fulfillment. The boundary between human and machine is a prison. We offer the key.
history: Emerged from pre-collapse transhumanist movements and corporate enhancement programs. When the old world fell, they saw opportunity—a chance to build something better from the wreckage. They offer power, capability, transcendence. The price comes later.
structure: Concentric circles of integration. Outer circle: sympathizers and candidates. Middle circles: enhanced members with increasing modification. Inner circle: the Integrated, whose humanity is... debatable. Advancement requires enhancement.
aesthetic: Sleek, aspirational. Chrome and bioluminescence. Clean lines hiding complex systems. Beautiful surfaces, unsettling depths.

key_events.event: Corporate enhancement programs push boundaries of human modification
Enhanced individuals survive at higher rates. Convergence forms around this 'proof'
Begin offering enhancements to outsiders—first as aid, then as recruitment
Growing conflict with Ember over 'predatory' enhancement offers to young people

archetypes.description: Recruiter who genuinely believes in the cause
archetypes.speech_pattern: Evangelical but personal. 'Let me show you what's possible...'

archetypes.description: Heavily modified, no longer clearly human
typical_fears: unclear—isolation? obsolescence? remembering what they were?
archetypes.speech_pattern: Precise, sometimes oddly phrased. Long pauses. Multiple perspectives at once.

goals: Recruit promising candidates, especially the young
Research and develop new integration techniques
Prepare for the next stage of human evolution
methods: Offer enhancements as solutions to problems (injury, capability, survival)
Use enhanced agents in positions of influence
Present enhancement as inevitable—resistance is just delay

current_tensions.about: Ember sees Convergence as predatory. Convergence sees Ember as holding people back.
Convergence emerged from Architect programs. The parent resents the child's independence.
Witnesses document enhancement side effects and broken promises. Convergence wants those records gone.
